attachment._content:
Mathieu De Keyzer
Web Team Leader & Web Project Manager

About Me

After 17 years in software development and more specifically in PHP
development, frontend development and distributed architectures;
I  never been scared to think out of the box and consider other
options. In order to re-focalize the development effort on the real
business needs and so improve the product quality and the user
experience. I  usually promote the use of libraries, toolboxes or
frameworks to speed up the development efforts. Even if I started my
own OpenSource CMS project.

People see me as someone of:

ready to make and assume decision & collaboration oriented
very pragmatic & intuitive
having a great learning capacity & creative

Willing to invest myself in ambitious projects inside of a motivated
team, I m always looking for innovative and elegant solution. Seeing
the software development as an all, Iʼm comfortable in all steps:
planning, needs, architecture, development and deployment. Iʼm also
convinced that only a collaboration of the full team guaranties the
motivation and the investment of everyone (Agile & DevOps).

Age

Email

Phone

Address

44 years old

mathieu@dekeyzer.net

+32 478 67.00.47

Anderlecht,
Brussels, Belgium

Technical Skills

Symfony Elasticsearch Ajax/JSON

Composer PHPStan & PHP-CS-Fixer Boostrap

JavaScript HTTP jQuery

WebPack Docker OpenShift

AWS (S3, EC2, ECS, RDS) ROCA Style PostgreSQL

RESTful Accessibility & WCAG HTML5 & CSS3

NPM & WebPack

Mathieu De Keyzer • +32 478 67.00.47 • https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium

https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
mailto:mathieu@dekeyzer.net
tel:+32478670047
https://www.google.be/maps/place/1070+Anderlecht/@50.8286437,4.2749205,14z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x47c3a4d1b60305a9:0xeba77790dbb9a06f!8m2!3d50.8365808!4d4.308187?hl=fr
https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/


 

Work Experience

Web Agency Manager  at Smals
September 2012 - Present

Co-Manager of the Smals's Web Agency with 32 people and about 100 federal websites
in several technologies; such as Symfony, Drupal, Wordpress. 
Implementation of DevOps approach, Agile methodology and improvement of the
delivery processes (budget, quality and planning). 
Coaching of the team; setting goals, definition of development plans and follow up with
the ambition to set up a self-organized team. 
Strategic vision of the team role and the product portfolio in order to deliver the best
services to our customers at short and long terms in accordance with the company
vision. 
Project management, customer relations and coordination with all stakeholders. 
Reporting to the direction and to the steering committees. 
Highly focused on the UX and on the accessibility of our websites. 
Introducing new tools and architecture in the team such as Symfony, Docker, SASS,
Gulp, Composer, WebPack, ECMAScript, Elasticsearch, ROCA, Angular, Cypress.io and
more.

Web Architect, Web Analyst & Web Programmer  at Syntigo on behalf of Alten Belgium
June 2012 - September 2012

Development of a proof-of-concept implementing a WOA solution (following ROCA
principles). 
Interfacing of the legacy Web Services (SOAP) with Jersey RESTful Web Services. 
Implementation of a user interface with the frameworks ExtJS (HTML5/CSS3).

ICT Project Manager & Software Analyst/Programmer  at Boston Scientific
July 2009 - January 2012

System extension of the clinical electronic data capture system (Medidata Rave) in order
to support corporate data files. 
Project management and follow-up. Defence of the project to the corporate hierarchy
(USA), to the customers (USA) and to the SQA (USA). 
Analysis of business needs and architecture in :

One J2EE layer for the business logic, using web-services XML/JSON
One interface layer: webapp with the frameworks ExtJS and Sencha Touch.

Mathieu De Keyzer • +32 478 67.00.47 • https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium

https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/


 

ICT Project Manager of CRM Clinical Trials  at Boston Scientific
August 2009 - March 2011

Study specific development with the corporate electronic data capture system (avec
Omnicomm EXPeRT) adjusted to the trial specific needs. 
Project management and follow-up. 
Defence of the project to the hierarchy and to theinternational customers.
Documentation and approval of the project to the SQA following a WaterFall
methodology. 
Defence of the critical path and negociation with the customer.

ICT Project Manager of the EDC system migration project  at Boston Scientific
August 2009 - December 2012

Migration and update of the International nlinical electronic data capture system in a
regulated environment. Project management, schedule and documentation. Risks
anticipation and risks management. Coordination between project resources (Belgium,
Ireland, USA).

Project Manager of easyfairs.com  at easyfairs on behalf of DS Improve
March 2009 - July 2009

Functional analysis and project management, team coordination 4 people. Analysis and
development of CMS plugins (PHP/TYPO3).

Web Agency Manager  at DS Improve
October 2008 - July 2009

Management of a Web development team: 5 developers web, 1 web designer et 1
integrator. Project management and customer relations. 
Writing and implementation of procedures. Coaching TYPO3, AJAX, jQuery, Dojo, HTML,
CMS, SVN.

Functional analyst and 3D developer  at an electronic banking company on behalf of DS
Improve
February 2007 - September 2008

Functional analysis and development in C++/DirectX of the user interface for an highly
secure home-banking system.

Mathieu De Keyzer • +32 478 67.00.47 • https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium

https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/


 

Education & Trainings

Functional analyst and analyst/developer of SFC2007  at the European commission on
behalf of DS Improve
October 2006 - April 2007

Administration system of the European funds from 2007 to 2013. J2EE (WebLogic),
Hibernate, Dojo.

Team leader of the Vision+ project  at DaimlerChrysler BeLux (Mercedes) on behalf of
DS Improve
July 2003 - December 2006

Iso-functional development in J2EE/WebSphere of the offer and order system: Vision.
Budget of 1.5M€, team leader of 6 people. Coaching J2EE and Struts.

Trainings
2021 - Angular&Typescript from U2U
2020 - Devops foundation from QRP
2020 - Leadership@Distance from Better Minds at Work
2019 - AWS: Architecture & Implementation from Orsys
2019 - Elasticsearch from Zenika
2018 - Introduction to WCAG 2.1 from AnySurfer
2017 - ECMScript 2017 & WebPack from Orsys
2017 - Anysurfer WCAG AA from AnySurfer
2015 - Extending & Hacking Symfony 2 from King foo
2015 - Usability of user interfaces for Smartphones and Tablets from Orsys
2015 - Frontend Rich Client from Vision Consulting Group
2014 - Symfony from Dawan
2014 - The leader-coach from Performance-Partners
2013 - AnySurfer for developers from AnySurfer
2013 - The result oriented leadership from Performance-Partners
2011 - Learn Sencha Touch from Sencha learning center
2010 - Business Oriented English from Call international
2009 - Intensive English from CLL
2009 - Dutch lessons from Cefora
2008 - English lessons from HEB
2008 - .NET with C# : advanced aspects from Cefora
2007 - Java : advanced aspects from Cefora
2006 - WebSphere server : performance settings from IBM

Mathieu De Keyzer • +32 478 67.00.47 • https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium

https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/


 

French

English

Dutch

Languages

Native

Good

Basis

Status

Interests

Other informations

Belgian, born February 1977 (44 years old), married,
two children

Photography, Cooking, Biking, Family, Web
Development, Submarines and DIY

 https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net

 https://github.com/theus77

 https://www.linkedin.com/in/mathieudk/

 https://www.instagram.com/dekeyzermathieu/

Master degree in Computer Science  from Université Libre de Bruxelles
2003

Grade: Distinction

Science and Mathematics  from Séminaire de Floreffe
1995

Schooling followed in boarding school

Mathieu De Keyzer • +32 478 67.00.47 • https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
Anderlecht, Brussels, Belgium

https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/
https://github.com/theus77
https://www.linkedin.com/in/mathieudk/
https://www.instagram.com/dekeyzermathieu/
https://mathieu.dekeyzer.net/

After 17 years in software development and more specifically in PHP development, frontend development and distributed architectures; I never been scared to think out of the box and consider other options. In order to re-focalize the development effort on the real business needs and so improve the product quality and the user experience. I usually promote the use of libraries, toolboxes or frameworks to speed up the development efforts. Even if I started my own OpenSource CMS project.

People see me as someone of:

  • ready to make and assume decision & collaboration oriented
  • very pragmatic & intuitive
  • having a great learning capacity & creative

Willing to invest myself in ambitious projects inside of a motivated team, I m always looking for innovative and elegant solution. Seeing the software development as an all, I’m comfortable in all steps: planning, needs, architecture, development and deployment. I’m also convinced that only a collaboration of the full team guaranties the motivation and the investment of everyone (Agile & DevOps).

description: Mathieu De Keyzer's Curriculum vitæn as Web Team Leader & Web Project Manager: About him, Technical Skills, Work Experience, Education & Trainings
label: Curriculum vitæ (en)
search:
After 17 years in software development and more specifically in PHP development, frontend development and distributed architectures; I never been scared to think out of the box and consider other options. In order to re-focalize the development effort on the real business needs and so improve the product quality and the user experience. I usually promote the use of libraries, toolboxes or frameworks to speed up the development efforts. Even if I started my own OpenSource CMS project.

People see me as someone of:


	ready to make and assume decision & collaboration oriented
	very pragmatic & intuitive
	having a great learning capacity & creative


Willing to invest myself in ambitious projects inside of a motivated team, I m always looking for innovative and elegant solution. Seeing the software development as an all, I’m comfortable in all steps: planning, needs, architecture, development and deployment. I’m also convinced that only a collaboration of the full team guaranties the motivation and the investment of everyone (Agile & DevOps).

Co-Manager of the Smals's Web Agency with 32 people and about 100 federal websites in several technologies; such as Symfony, Drupal, Wordpress.
Implementation of DevOps approach, Agile methodology and improvement of the delivery processes (budget, quality and planning).
Coaching of the team; setting goals, definition of development plans and follow up with the ambition to set up a self-organized team.
Strategic vision of the team role and the product portfolio in order to deliver the best services to our customers at short and long terms in accordance with the company vision.
Project management, customer relations and coordination with all stakeholders.
Reporting to the direction and to the steering committees.
Highly focused on the UX and on the accessibility of our websites.
Introducing new tools and architecture in the team such as Symfony, Docker, SASS, Gulp, Composer, WebPack, ECMAScript, Elasticsearch, ROCA, Angular, Cypress.io and more.
Web Architect, Web Analyst & Web Programmer

Development of a proof-of-concept implementing a WOA solution (following ROCA principles).
Interfacing of the legacy Web Services (SOAP) with Jersey RESTful Web Services.
Implementation of a user interface with the frameworks ExtJS (HTML5/CSS3).
at Syntigo on behalf of Alten Belgium

System extension of the clinical electronic data capture system (Medidata Rave) in order to support corporate data files.
Project management and follow-up. Defence of the project to the corporate hierarchy (USA), to the customers (USA) and to the SQA (USA).
Analysis of business needs and architecture in :


	One J2EE layer for the business logic, using web-services XML/JSON
	One interface layer: webapp with the frameworks ExtJS and Sencha Touch.
ICT Project Manager of CRM Clinical Trials
